intro: Ranunculus magnitorifer, commonly known as the showy buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features showy, bright yellow flowers with numerous petals arranged in a cup-like formation. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with simple, alternate, palmately lobed leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and it thrives in well-drained, alkaline soils. Ranunculus magnitorifer is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it adapts to harsh climatic conditions.
